text: Carl Sandburg (January 6, 1878 - July 22, 1967) was an American poet. He won several awards, including three Pulitzer Prizes. He also wrote a biography of Abraham Lincoln. The majority of his poems were about the city of Chicago. He was born in Galesburg, Illinois. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America Category:Writers from Illinois Category:American poets Category:Pulitzer Prize winners Category:1878 births Category:1967 deaths Category:Industrial Workers of the World
title: Carl Sandburg
